newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican maquiladora jobs up 19.7 pct in July.
newsitem.headline: Mexican maquiladora jobs up 19.7 pct in July.

text.p: Employment in the Mexican maquiladora export industry grew 19.7 percent in July versus the same period last year, for a combined increase of 15.4 percent in the first seven months of the year, the National Statistics Institute (INEGI) said on Wednesday.

It said in a monthly report that the industry, which is comprised of assembly plants mostly along the U.S. border, employed 761,705 people in July, up from 636,118 in the same month last year. In the January-July period, some 82.4 percent of maquiladoras were located in the northern states of Chihuahua, Baja California, Tamaulipas, Coahuila and Sonora.
In the same period, the industry generated accumulated export value added of 26.035 billion pesos, INEGI said.
